seo_keywords: Bissell Pet Hair Eraser blowing dust

problems.title: Blowing Dust Out / Loss of Suction
problems.description: Dust is escaping from the vents or suction is very weak.
solution_steps: Inspect the pleated filter. If it has holes, replace it immediately.
Tap the filter against a trash can to remove fine dust.

problems.title: Rubber Nozzle Worn / Lost
problems.description: The rubber teeth on the nozzle are worn down or the nozzle is lost.
solution_steps: The rubber nozzle is essential for picking up hair.
It pulls off easily and can be replaced.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the suction on a Pet Hair Eraser Handheld Vacuum (33A1)?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement filter or seal typically costs significantly less than a new $303 vacuum, and extending the life of your Bissell is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Pet Hair Eraser Handheld Vacuum (33A1) needs a new filter or seal?
faqs.answer: Common signs include strange noises and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the filter or seal on my Pet Hair Eraser Handheld Vacuum (33A1) myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
